skill.name: fda-database
skill.description: Query openFDA API for drugs, devices, adverse events, recalls, regulatory submissions (510k, PMA), substance identification (UNII), for FDA regulatory data analysis and safety research.
skill.summary: Query openFDA API for drugs, devices, adverse events, recalls, regulatory submissions (510k, PMA), s...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or exfiltration patterns found. Network calls target the documented openFDA API for expected data retrieval.

content.user_title: Query FDA data fast with openFDA
content.value_statement: FDA regulatory datasets are large and hard to query consistently. This skill provides ready Python helpers for openFDA searches, counts, and pagination.
actual_capabilities: Query drug, device, food, animal, and substance endpoints
Build search, count, and sort queries with one method
Paginate large result sets with query_all
Apply automatic rate limiting per minute
Cache API responses to disk with TTL
limitations: Limited to fields and datasets exposed by openFDA
No built in visualization or persistent storage
API rate limits apply even with a key

use_cases.title: Adverse event trends
use_cases.description: Track drug event volumes, serious case rates, and leading reactions over time.

use_cases.title: Device safety monitoring
use_cases.description: Review device event reports, classifications, and recent recalls for a product line.

use_cases.title: Recall surveillance
use_cases.description: Monitor allergen related recalls and summarize recent enforcement actions.

prompt_templates.title: Get drug events
prompt_templates.prompt: Use FDAQuery to fetch the last 20 adverse events for aspirin and summarize top reactions.

prompt_templates.title: Check device recalls
prompt_templates.prompt: Search openFDA device enforcement data for pacemaker recalls and list recall reasons and dates.

prompt_templates.title: Food recall scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Find food recalls mentioning undeclared peanut and summarize classification and status.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative safety
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare serious event rates for aspirin, ibuprofen, and naproxen using openFDA event counts.

output_examples.input: Summarize recent Class I recalls for metformin.
output: Found several Class I recalls for metformin in the last year.
Top reasons include contamination and labeling issues.
Most recalls were initiated by manufacturers and are now completed.

best_practices: Use specific field queries instead of broad wildcards
Set an API key for higher rate limits
Check for empty results and error fields before analysis
anti_patterns: Running high volume queries without pagination limits
Assuming every record contains all fields
Using raw user input without cleaning search terms

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides Python scripts and guidance that work in those tools.

faq.question: What are the data limits?
faq.answer: Limits follow openFDA rate policies and per request caps of up to 1000 results.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my own pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Import FDAQuery and call methods from your Python workflow.

faq.question: Does it access my local credentials?
faq.answer: No. It only reads the FDA_API_KEY environment variable if you set it.

faq.question: What if I get no results or errors?
faq.answer: Broaden your search terms, check query syntax, and confirm network access.

faq.question: How does it compare to direct API calls?
faq.answer: It adds caching, rate limiting, and helper methods around openFDA endpoints.
